description: The `synthetic.inventory_counts` table is designed to store information about inventory levels within a system; however, it currently does not contain any data. The table's primary key is `count_id`, which uniquely identifies each record, and it is set to reference another unspecified entity, suggesting its role in tracking inventory changes or audits related to that entity. Although precise inter-table relationships and the specifics of its columns are not provided, the table likely plays a critical role in maintaining inventory accountability within the broader synthetic database architecture.

columns.name: warehouse_id
columns.description: Identifies a specific storage location within the inventory system, where products are stored and managed. Purpose unclear from available data.

columns.name: count_date
columns.description: This column likely represents the specific date on which inventory quantities were recorded or assessed. It is a critical field for tracking inventory changes over time.

columns.name: status
columns.description: This field likely indicates the current state or progress of inventory counts, with a default state suggesting that counts are initially anticipated or scheduled.

columns.name: created_at
columns.description: Records the date and time when an inventory count entry is created in the system. Purpose unclear from available data.

columns.name: updated_at
columns.description: This column likely records the last time an update was made to the inventory counts, aiding in tracking changes over time. Purpose unclear from available data.

indexes.index_definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX inventory_counts_count_number_key ON synthetic.inventory_counts USING btree (count_number)
CREATE UNIQUE INDEX inventory_counts_pkey ON synthetic.inventory_counts USING btree (count_id)
